comments:
This happens in Eclipse 3.1RC2. In 3.1RC1 it worked well.

Steps to reproduce:
* select "File | Export...", choose "Eclipse product"
* on a subsequent page, click "Browse..." next to a "Configuration" combo

Eclipse displays a series of warning dialogs "Resource [project] is not open."
for *each* [project] in the workspace (most of them are not part of the product,
and those which are, are all open). Then the workbench closes automatically.

The .log file contains a series of the forementioned warnings, e.g.:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 372 2005-06-13 10:56:41.378
!MESSAGE Resource /[project] is not open.

and the following exception:

and some additional NoClassDefFoundError's and ClassNotFoundException's from
other plugins that seem to be unrelated.

Janek, please investigate for RC3.

I suspect the problem here is that we are not excluding closed projects when 
populating the dialog.

The dialog is populated fine.  the error dialog is coming from Resources.

Simple Test case:

Create a project.
Close it.
Try to delete it using Delete in the context menu.

You will get an error dialog saying that 'Resource /aaa is not open'.

Interestingly, deleting using the DEL button works.
I meant deleting the project, without deleting the contents, works.

There might still remain a PDE or UI issue to address but the Resources one 
has to be done first.

ReadOnlyStateChecker is calling #members on the closed project. This will throw
an exception and is spec'd to do so. (See also bug 98740 which was that it
didn't throw an exception even though it was spec'd to do so.)

Thread [main] (Suspended (breakpoint at line 127 in Project))

moving to PDE ui, I don't see how UI has changed anything from RC1 - RC2 to
affect this.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 99858 ***

The first part of this bug in my case is indeed caused by the
IContainer.members() method being called on closed projects from
FileExtensionFilter.select() (which is called from ElementTreeSelectionDialog
both directly and indirectly). I was able to figure it out by debugging the
runtime workbench.

However the second part of the bug - SWT "no more handles" error caused by the
PDEPlugin.java, line 122, being called from itself over and over (note "[...]"
in my stacktrace) and then the automatic workbench shutdown - is still a puzzle
to me. I wasn't able to reproduce it in the runtime workbench. Can you please
comment on that?

Although bug 99858 has already been fixed (testcase mentioned in comment 2 here
as well as in bug 99858 itself works ok), this bug still occurs (tested with
Eclipse 3.2M1). The only difference for me is that "No more handles" error is no
longer thrown and the workbench does not close automatically. Warning dialogs
are still displayed though.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 106469 ***
